Comment: This command info is generated from fig
Name: arduino-cli

Arguments.Name: --additional-urls
Arguments.Description: Comma-separated list of additional URLs for the Boards Manager

Arguments.Name: --config-file
Arguments.Description: The custom config file (if not specified the default will be used)

Arguments.Name: --format
Arguments.Description: The output format for the logs, can be: text, json, jsonmini, yaml (default 'text')

Arguments.Name: --log
Arguments.Description: Print the logs on the standard output

Arguments.Name: --log-file
Arguments.Description: Path to the file where logs will be written

Arguments.Name: --log-format
Arguments.Description: The output format for the logs, can be: text, json

Arguments.Name: --log-level
Arguments.Description: Messages with this level and above will be logged. Valid levels are: trace, debug, info, warn, error, fatal, panic

Arguments.Name: attach
Arguments.Description: Sets the default values for port and FQBN. If no port or FQBN are specified, the current default port and FQBN are displayed

Arguments.Name: --board-options
Arguments.Description: List of board options separated by commas. Or can be used multiple times for multiple options

Arguments.Name: --discovery-timeout
Arguments.Description: Max time to wait for port discovery, example: '30s, 1m (default 1s)'

Arguments.Name: details
Arguments.Description: Show information about a board, in particular if the board has options to be specified in the FQBN'

Arguments.Name: --board-options
Arguments.Description: List of board options separated by commas. Or can be used multiple times for multiple options

Arguments.Name: --show-properties
Arguments.Description: Show build properties. The properties are expanded, use "--show-properties=unexpanded" if you want them exactly as they are defined. (default "disabled")

Arguments.Name: list
Arguments.Description: Detects and displays a list of boards connected to the current computer

Arguments.Name: --board-options
Arguments.Description: List of board options separated by commas. Or can be used multiple times for multiple options

Arguments.Name: --discovery-timeout
Arguments.Description: Max time to wait for port discovery, example: '30s, 1m (default 1s)'

Arguments.Name: -w
Arguments.Description: Command keeps running and prints list of connected boards whenever there is a change

Arguments.Name: listall
Arguments.Description: List all boards that have the support platform installed, You can search for a specific board if you specify the board name

Arguments.Name: -a
Arguments.Description: Show also boards marked as 'hidden' in the platform

Arguments.Name: search
Arguments.Description: Search for a board in the Boards Manager using the specified keywords

Arguments.Name: -a
Arguments.Description: Show also boards marked as 'hidden' in the platform

Arguments.Name: burn-bootloader
Arguments.Description: Upload the bootloader on the board using an external programmer

Arguments.Name: --board-options
Arguments.Description: List of board options separated by commas. Or can be used multiple times for multiple options

Arguments.Name: --discovery-timeout
Arguments.Description: Max time to wait for port discovery, example: '30s, 1m (default 1s)'

Arguments.Name: clean
Arguments.Description: Delete contents of the directories.downloads folder, where archive files are staged during installation of libraries and boards platforms

Arguments.Name: --board-options
Arguments.Description: List of board options separated by commas. Or can be used multiple times for multiple option

Arguments.Name: --build-cache-path
Arguments.Description: Builds of 'core.a' are saved into this path to be cached and reused

Arguments.Name: --build-path
Arguments.Description: Path where to save compiled files. If omitted, a directory will be created in the default temporary path of your OS

Arguments.Name: --build-property
Arguments.Description: Override a build property with a custom value. Can be used multiple times for multiple properties

Arguments.Name: --clean
Arguments.Description: Optional, cleanup the build folder and do not use any cached build

Arguments.Name: --discovery-timeout
Arguments.Description: Max time to wait for port discovery, example: '30s, 1m (default 1s)'

Arguments.Name: --dump-profile
Arguments.Description: Create and print a profile configuration from the build

Arguments.Name: --encrypt-key
Arguments.Description: The name of the custom encryption key to use to encrypt a binary during the compile process. Used only by the platforms that support it

Arguments.Name: e
Arguments.Description: If set built binaries will be exported to the sketch folder

Arguments.Name: --keys-keychain
Arguments.Description: The path of the dir to search for the custom keys to sign and encrypt a binary. Used only by the platforms that support it

Arguments.Name: --libraries
Arguments.Description: Path to a collection of libraries. Can be used multiple times or entries can be comma separated

Arguments.Name: --library
Arguments.Description: Path to a single library’s root folder. Can be used multiple times or entries can be comma separated

Arguments.Name: --only-compilation-database
Arguments.Description: Just produce the compilation database, without actually compiling. All build commands are skipped except pre* hooks

Arguments.Name: --optimize-for-debug
Arguments.Description: Optional, optimize compile output for debugging, rather than for release

Arguments.Name: --output-dir
Arguments.Description: Save build artifacts in this directory

Arguments.Name: --preprocess
Arguments.Description: Print preprocessed code to stdout instead of compiling

Arguments.Name: --show-properties
Arguments.Description: Show build properties. The properties are expanded, use "--show-properties=unexpanded" if you want them exactly as they are defined. (default "disabled")

Arguments.Name: --sign-key
Arguments.Description: The name of the custom signing key to use to sign a binary during the compile process. Used only by the platforms that support it

Arguments.Name: -u
Arguments.Description: Upload the binary after the compilation

Arguments.Name: -t
Arguments.Description: Verify uploaded binary after the upload

Arguments.Name: --warnings
Arguments.Description: Optional, can be: none, default, more, all. Used to tell gcc which warning level to use (-W flag). (default "none")

Arguments.Name: completion
Arguments.Description: Generates completion scripts for various shells

Arguments.Name: --no-description
Arguments.Description: Disable completion description for shells that support it

Arguments.Name: add
Arguments.Description: Adds one or more values to a setting

Arguments.Name: delete
Arguments.Description: Deletes a settings key and all its sub keys

Arguments.Name: init
Arguments.Description: Creates or updates the configuration file in the data directory or custom directory with the current configuration settings

Arguments.Name: --dest-dir
Arguments.Description: Sets where to save the configuration file

Arguments.Name: --dest-file
Arguments.Description: Sets where to save the configuration file

Arguments.Name: remove
Arguments.Description: Removes one or more values from a setting

Arguments.Name: download
Arguments.Description: Downloads one or more cores and corresponding tool dependencies

Arguments.Name: install
Arguments.Description: Installs one or more cores and corresponding tool dependencies

Arguments.Name: --no-overwrite
Arguments.Description: Do not overwrite already installed platforms

Arguments.Name: --run-post-install
Arguments.Description: Force run of post-install scripts (if the CLI is not running interactively)

Arguments.Name: --run-pre-uninstall
Arguments.Description: Force run of pre-uninstall scripts (if the CLI is not running interactively)

Arguments.Name: --skip-post-install
Arguments.Description: Force skip of post-install scripts (if the CLI is running interactively)

Arguments.Name: --skip-pre-uninstall
Arguments.Description: Force skip of pre-uninstall scripts (if the CLI is running interactively)

Arguments.Name: list
Arguments.Description: Show the list of installed platforms

Arguments.Name: all
Arguments.Description: If set return all installable and installed cores, including manually installed

Arguments.Name: search
Arguments.Description: Search for a core in Boards Manager using the specified keywords

Arguments.Name: uninstall
Arguments.Description: Uninstalls one or more cores and corresponding tool dependencies if no longer used

Arguments.Name: --run-post-install
Arguments.Description: Force run of post-install scripts (if the CLI is not running interactively)

Arguments.Name: --run-pre-uninstall
Arguments.Description: Force run of pre-uninstall scripts (if the CLI is not running interactively)

Arguments.Name: --skip-post-install
Arguments.Description: Force skip of post-install scripts (if the CLI is running interactively)

Arguments.Name: --skip-pre-uninstall
Arguments.Description: Force skip of pre-uninstall scripts (if the CLI is running interactively)

Arguments.Name: update-index
Arguments.Description: Updates the index of cores to the latest version

Arguments.Name: upgrade
Arguments.Description: Upgrades one or all installed platforms to the latest version

Arguments.Name: --run-post-install
Arguments.Description: Force run of post-install scripts (if the CLI is not running interactively)

Arguments.Name: --run-pre-uninstall
Arguments.Description: Force run of pre-uninstall scripts (if the CLI is not running interactively)

Arguments.Name: --skip-post-install
Arguments.Description: Force skip of post-install scripts (if the CLI is running interactively)

Arguments.Name: --skip-pre-uninstall
Arguments.Description: Force skip of pre-uninstall scripts (if the CLI is running interactively)

Arguments.Name: daemon
Arguments.Description: Run as a daemon on port: 50051, the initialization of cores and libraries is done only once

Arguments.Name: --daemonize
Arguments.Description: Do not terminate daemon process if the parent process dies

Arguments.Name: --debug
Arguments.Description: Enable debug logging of gRPC calls

Arguments.Name: --debug-file
Arguments.Description: Append debug logging to the specified file

Arguments.Name: --debug-filter
Arguments.Description: Display only the provided gRPC calls

Arguments.Name: --port
Arguments.Description: The TCP port the daemon will listen to

Arguments.Name: debug
Arguments.Description: Debug Arduino sketches. (this command opens an interactive gdb session)

Arguments.Name: --board-options
Arguments.Description: List of board options separated by commas. Or can be used multiple times for multiple options

Arguments.Name: --discovery-timeout
Arguments.Description: Max time to wait for port discovery, example: '30s, 1m (default 1s)'

Arguments.Name: -I
Arguments.Description: Show metadata about the debug session instead of starting the debugger

Arguments.Name: --interpreter
Arguments.Description: Debug interpreter, example: console, mi, mi1, mi2, mi3 (default "console")

Arguments.Name: check
Arguments.Description: Check if the given board/programmer combination supports debugging

Arguments.Name: --board-options
Arguments.Description: List of board options separated by commas. Or can be used multiple times for multiple options

Arguments.Name: --discovery-timeout
Arguments.Description: Max time to wait for port discovery, example: '30s, 1m (default 1s)'

Arguments.Name: --interpreter
Arguments.Description: Debug interpreter, example: console, mi, mi1, mi2, mi3 (default "console")

Arguments.Name: help
Arguments.Description: Help provides help for any command in the application

Arguments.Name: deps
Arguments.Description: Check dependencies status for the specified library

Arguments.Name: download
Arguments.Description: Downloads one or more libraries without installing them

Arguments.Name: examples
Arguments.Description: Shows the list of the examples for libraries. A name may be given as argument to search a specific library

Arguments.Name: --board-options
Arguments.Description: List of board options separated by commas. Or can be used multiple times for multiple options

Arguments.Name: install
Arguments.Description: Installs one or more specified libraries into the system

Arguments.Name: --git-url
Arguments.Description: Enter git url for libraries hosted on repositories

Arguments.Name: --install-in-builtin-dir
Arguments.Description: Install libraries in the IDE-Builtin directory

Arguments.Name: --no-overwrite
Arguments.Description: Do not overwrite already installed libraries

Arguments.Name: --zip-path
Arguments.Description: Enter a path to zip file

Arguments.Name: list
Arguments.Description: Shows a list of installed libraries. If the LIBNAME parameter is specified the listing is limited to that specific library. By default the libraries provided as built-in by platforms/core are not listed, they can be listed by adding the --all flag

Arguments.Name: --all
Arguments.Description: Include built-in libraries (from platforms and IDE) in listing

Arguments.Name: --board-options
Arguments.Description: List of board options separated by commas. Or can be used multiple times for multiple options

Arguments.Name: search
Arguments.Description: Search for one or more libraries data (case insensitive search)

Arguments.Name: --omit-releases-details
Arguments.Description: Omit library details far all versions except the latest (produce a more compact JSON output)

Arguments.Name: update-index
Arguments.Description: Updates the libraries index to the latest version

Arguments.Name: upgrade
Arguments.Description: Upgrades installed libraries. This command upgrades an installed library to the latest available version. Multiple libraries can be passed separated by a space. If no arguments are provided, the command will upgrade all the installed libraries where an update is available

Arguments.Name: monitor
Arguments.Description: Open a communication port with a board

Arguments.Name: --board-options
Arguments.Description: List of board options separated by commas. Or can be used multiple times for multiple options

Arguments.Name: -c
Arguments.Description: Configure communication port settings. The format is <ID>=<value>[,<ID>=<value>]

Arguments.Name: --describe
Arguments.Description: Show all the settings of the communication port

Arguments.Name: --discovery-timeout
Arguments.Description: Max time to wait for port discovery, example: '30s, 1m (default 1s)'

Arguments.Name: -q
Arguments.Description: Run in silent mode, show only monitor input and output

Arguments.Name: outdated
Arguments.Description: This commands shows a list of installed cores and/or libraries that can be upgraded. If nothing needs to be updated the output is empty

Arguments.Name: archive
Arguments.Description: Creates a zip file containing all sketch files

Arguments.Name: --include-build-dir
Arguments.Description: Includes build in directory in the archive

Arguments.Name: update
Arguments.Description: Updates the index of cores and libraries to the latest versions

Arguments.Name: --show-outdated
Arguments.Description: Show outdated cores and libraries after index update

Arguments.Name: upgrade
Arguments.Description: Upgrades installed cores and libraries to latest version

Arguments.Name: --run-post-install
Arguments.Description: Force run of post-install scripts (if the CLI is not running interactively)

Arguments.Name: --run-pre-uninstall
Arguments.Description: Force run of pre-uninstall scripts (if the CLI is not running interactively)

Arguments.Name: --skip-post-install
Arguments.Description: Force skip of post-install scripts (if the CLI is running interactively)

Arguments.Name: --skip-pre-uninstall
Arguments.Description: Force skip of pre-uninstall scripts (if the CLI is running interactively)

Arguments.Name: upload
Arguments.Description: Upload Arduino sketches. This does NOT compile the sketch prior to upload

Arguments.Name: --board-options
Arguments.Description: List of board options separated by commas. Or can be used multiple times for multiple options

Arguments.Name: --discovery-timeout
Arguments.Description: Max time to wait for port discovery, example: '30s, 1m (default 1s)'

Arguments.Name: -p
Arguments.Description: Binary file to upload, example: 'COM3 or /dev/ttyACM2'

Arguments.Name: -F
Arguments.Description: Set a value for a field required to upload, 'key=value'

Arguments.Name: -t
Arguments.Description: Verify uploaded binary after the upload

Arguments.Name: version
Arguments.Description: Shows the version number of Arduino CLI which is installed on your system
